pros: Teachers are very helpful and engaging. Wide variety of courses available. Very good tuition rate
cons: Felt like there could have been more resources, i.e; some of the printers were not that high quality prints.

pros:
Amazing Benefits
Tons of Time off 
Flexible schedule
cons:
High level of corporate disfunction
The president has absolutely no management skills and it shows
Areas that have a VP that is highly favored with the president are awarded more resources and treated more fairly.

pros: Flexible schedule, decent pay for a student job
cons: No long-term potential, no benefits, few hours

pros: Most of the people I have encountered have the students' best interests in mind.
cons: Poor communication, lack of advancement opportunity

review_title: Similar as other colleges that say the student comes first
pros: Good people that work there, campus is great, There are some good benefits.
cons: Human Resource will lie to applicants telling them they can give any more pay than what is first offered.  I've seen them give others much more if they turn down the offer which causes an imbalance of fair pay.  Money and credit hours is the most important, same as WMU, the students may be 3rd.  There are certainly employees trying to keep the student first but management doesn't act that way.  Micro Management by upper administration.

job_title: Part Time Instructor in Kalamazoo, MI
pros: The best things to work at this company were that there was a great deal of autonomy available for experience employees. You do not have much oversight or interaction with administrative staff unless you need to.
cons:
The administrative staff sees you as a line item at best. Moves you around at will. You are always third or fourth fiddle to full time instructors. Cancel classes based on enrollment easily and do not encourage unionized labour. The administrative staff is very inflexible and does not like to partner with instructors to achieve mutually beneficial goals. 

They basically want you to come in, teach, and leave. Don't ask questions, don't try to change anything, don't have life issues or anything. Quality of the instructor is negligible. They care more about numbers rather than instructor quality. 

Also, don't cancel a day for class. They will cut your pay if you miss a day.

pros: Great to work around students that want to be there.  Lots of good employees.  Good benefits with time off and medical.
cons: Low pay compared to colleges around Michigan, you have to be willing to dicker with them when you start or you will never catch up because they will not give you a raise later to catch up.  Top heavy, too many chiefs and not enough indians I've heard others say that also.

review_title: Make sure you stay in your lane
pros: Beautiful campuses, great co workers, excellent health and retirement benefits
cons:
Pres is a micromanager. Most of the VPs are out of touch and would rather run the place into the ground than admit they don’t know everything. Only FT Faculty and Administration seem to matter. 
The Compensation system is laughable.  It values new hires far more then current employees and one person controls the whole process.

review_title: Not bad but not good either
pros: They have good health benefits and an overall optimistic atmosphere.
cons: There is virtually no communication between departments. Managers do not support employees and do not give them the ability to make their own decisions. All decisions come from the top down. There is not accountability and most are give responsibility but no authority.

job_title: Clinical Nurse Instructor in Kalamazoo, MI
pros: I enjoy teaching students in the lab and in the clinical setting.  Great people to work with, and great lead instructors.
cons: Part time instructors have limited contact with students in their lab time since instruction in the lab can only be done by MSN prepared nurses.

pros: Great coworkers, Nice space, Lots of windows and nature, a beautiful campus. A really pleasant environment overall.
cons: Sometimes students can be a bit difficult to deal with, but that happens anytime you work public service. Saturday hours are weird.

job_title: Wellness Center Staff in Kalamazoo, MI
pros: Flexible hours for students. Paid on days the school closes because of weather. Can do homework at the front desk when not busy.
cons: Late nights or early mornings, short shifts, minimum wage

pros: Spent ten years here as a part time math tutor and got a 5% raise every single year.
cons: There were not really many opportunities for advancement, at least not in the area in which I worked.

review_title: KVCC is a good school with intelligent people working there
pros: The athletic department has good communication, and works together well.
cons: Some of the facilities are not as good as other colleges.

pros: I am working at KVCC for 2 monts only. I love the college and the physics depatment is great, excellent place to build experience
cons: Job is a temporary hard to find a full time position

job_title: Certified Writing and Business Tutor & Testing Center Desk Clerk in Kalamazoo, MI
pros:
flexible schedule, including during exam week
caring bosses in the Learning Center
cons:
stagnant pay, even though there are cost of living increases
Some shifts may be short

pros: Community is great, the school is great, excellent place to build experience
cons: pay is horrible, very little chance to get full time.

pros: Great staff, welcome environment, and flexibility in most schedules.
cons: Pay for full-time employees is not always the best.
